candidates.name: Lhamo Kyab
candidates.occupation: Assistant Professor, MVJ College (Department of Forensic Science)
candidates.briefBio: Lhamo Kyab arrived in India at the age of five. He completed his secondary education at TCV Suja and pursued his senior secondary education at TCV Bylakuppe. He subsequently obtained a Bachelor's degree in Forensic Science from Jain University, followed by a Master's degree in Forensic Science from Christ University. Upon the completion of his studies, he joined Infinity College of Education in Trivandrum, Kerala, as a lecturer. He is currently serving as an Assistant Professor in Forensic Science at MVJ College in Bangalore.

Goals/Commitments:
• To actively engage in Tibetan public affairs in alignment with the guidance and aspirations of His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama
• To uphold a principled and firm position on the Tibet–China issue, based on the real situation and grounded in peaceful and non-violent dialogue
• To contribute toward improving living conditions and reducing poverty within the Tibetan exile community, with particular attention to the welfare of both the elderly and the youth
• To advocate for women, children, orphans, and vulnerable or marginalized young Tibetans newly arrived from Tibet
• To promote awareness and deeper understanding of the Tibetan cause among students in Indian universities through bilingual education in English and Hindi

candidates.name: Dawa Tsering Bari
candidates.occupation: Former Director, Tibetan Policy Institute of CTA
candidates.briefBio: Born in Gawa, Yushu (Kham), he fled Tibet in 1992 and served the CTA for 32 years with distinction. His career included roles as Special Coordinator for Sino-Tibetan Dialogue, Representative of His Holiness in Taiwan (2008-2021), and Director of the Tibetan Policy Institute (2022-2025). He is an accomplished author and scholar known for his diplomatic achievements and defense of Tibetan Buddhism in Taiwan.

candidates.name: Jamyang Sherab
candidates.briefBio: Born on April 8, 1990, in a Tibetan nomadic and agricultural family in Chushul, Ladakh. He served four years in the Central Tibetan Administration in the Departments of Education and Health, pioneering the Online Scholarship Application system and implementing projects benefiting Tibetan communities across 27 settlements. He volunteered as a frontline worker during COVID-19 and ran as a candidate for the 17th TPiE from U-Tsang in 2021. Currently focused on grassroots development, he works with local organizations improving livelihoods of mountain communities including Tibetan nomadic populations.
